displaytitle: Reclining youth with a staff, seen from below
medium:
Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash on cream
laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Reclining youth with a staff, seen from below

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Possibly until 1852, Count Algarotti-Corniani, Venice, Italy.

possibly 1852, bought by Edward Cheney, Badger Hall, Shropshire;

29 April, 1885, Cheney Sale, Sotheby’s, lot 1024.

14 July, 1914, Christie's, lot 49.

1922, purchased by E. Parsons & Sons, London;

between 1922-1926, purchased by Dan Fellows Platt;

Bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum

bibliography.boilertext: George Knox, "Drawings by Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo at Princeton", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 23, no. 1 (1964): p. 2-28.
bibliography.citation: George Knox, "Drawings by Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo at Princeton", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 23, no. 1 (1964): p. 2-28., p. 11, no. 35; p. 15 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Alfred Stix and L. Fröhlich-Bum, Die Zeichnungen der venezianischen Schule, (Wien: A. Schroll, 1926).
bibliography.citation: Alfred Stix and L. Fröhlich-Bum, Die Zeichnungen der venezianischen Schule, (Wien: A. Schroll, 1926)., no. 289-295

bibliography.boilertext: Detlev von Hadeln, The drawings of G.B. Tiepolo, (Paris: Pegasus press, 1928).
bibliography.citation: Detlev von Hadeln, The drawings of G.B. Tiepolo, (Paris: Pegasus press, 1928)., pl. 83, 84, 87

bibliography.boilertext: Andrea Carlino, Anna Luppi, Roberto Paolo Ciardi, Annamaria Petrioli Tofani, et. al., Visioni Anatomiche: le forme del corpo negli anni del Barocco, (Cinisello Balsamo: Silvana editoriale, 2011).
bibliography.citation: Andrea Carlino, Anna Luppi, Roberto Paolo Ciardi, Annamaria Petrioli Tofani, et. al., Visioni Anatomiche: le forme del corpo negli anni del Barocco, (Cinisello Balsamo: Silvana editoriale, 2011).

bibliography.boilertext: Jacob Bean, Italian drawings in the Art Museum, Princeton University; 106 selected examples, (New York: October House, 1966).
bibliography.citation: Jacob Bean, Italian drawings in the Art Museum, Princeton University; 106 selected examples, (New York: October House, 1966)., no. 92

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 192, no. 610 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)
